0.user_question:
The data in the table below shows the percent of bus riders in a survey of Central H.S. students; 300 males and 300 females in each grade were surveyed. For which grade is the number of its male bus riders closest to $135\%$ of the number of its female bus riders? \begin{tabular}{|l|c|c|}\hline
Grade & Males & Females \\ \hline
$9^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $41.1\%$ & $39.4\%$ \\ \hline
$10^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $34.4\%$ & $33.1\%$ \\ \hline
$11^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $20.6\%$ & $13.8\%$ \\ \hline
$12^{\mathrm{th}}$ grade & $11.6\%$ & $8.6\%$ \\ \hline
\end{tabular}

direct_answer.text:
Let's calculate how close each grade's male bus riders percentage is to being exactly $135\%$ of the female bus riders percentages:

For $9^{th}$ grade:
\[41.1\% \approx 135\% \times 39.4\% \rightarrow 0.411/0.394 \approx 1.048.\]

For $10^{th}$ grade:
\[34.4\% \approx 135\% \times 33.1\% \rightarrow 0.344/0.331 \approx 1.039.\]

For $11^{th}$ grade:
\[20.6\% \approx 135\% \times 13.8\% \rightarrow 0.206/0.138 \approx 1.496.\]

For $12^{th}$ grade:
\[11.6\% \approx 135\% \times 8.6\% \rightarrow 0.116/0.086 \approx 1.353.\.\

1.subquestion: What is the formula for finding how many males ride the bus in a grade based on percentages provided?

subanswer.text:
To find how many males ride the bus in a particular grade based on the percentage provided, you would use the following formula:

\[ \text{Number of Male Bus Riders} = \text{Total Number of Students in Grade} \times \left( \frac{\text{Percentage of Males Riding Bus}}{100} \right) \]

Given the specific percentages for each grade and the fact that 300 males and 300 females were surveyed in each grade, let's apply it for one of the grades as an example:

For the $9^{th}$ grade:

\[ \text{Male Bus Riders in } 9^{th} \text{ grade} = 300 \times \left(\frac{41.1}{100}\right) = 300 \times 0.411 = 123.3 \]

You would similarly calculate for other grades using their respective percentages. You would compare these calculated numbers to determine which grade's number of male bus riders is closest to \(135\%\) of the number of its female bus riders.
